docs.text: Hi! Welcome on my personal webpage. My name is Frédéric Hamelin and I am Associate Professor at L'institut Agro in Rennes, France. I work at the interface between Mathematical Ecology and Plant Disease Epidemiology. I am a member of the Demecology (Dynamics, Evolution, Modelling, Ecology) research group of the Institute of Genetics, Environment and Plant Protection ( IGEPP ). Short bio I was first trained as a telecommunications engineer in Brest, Brittany, France. In 2007, I received a PhD in automatic control from the University of Nice, France (supervisors: Pierre Bernhard and Eric Wajnberg ). During my doctoral thesis and then as a postdoctoral researcher at the University of Alberta, Canada (with Mark A. Lewis ), I explored differential games and their applications to behavioral ecology. Back to Brittany, I joined L'institut Agro in 2008 as faculty member in the department of ecology in Rennes. In 2017, I obtained my Habilitation in ecology and evolution from the University of Rennes. Contact Email: \small \mbox{frederic.hamelin@agrocampus-ouest.fr} Postal address: L'institut Agro, Ecologie et Santé des Plantes, 65 rue de Saint Brieuc, 35042 Rennes, France. Last update on April 10, 2021.

IMMUnE Immunity and Mathematical Modelling to Unify plant disease Epidemiology, funded by INRAE "Plant Health and the Environment" division. PhD student Pauline Clin is partly funded by the Council of Brittany Region. Past events BioHasard 2019 I co-organized the international conference on Stochastic Models for Biology: BioHasard 2019 , August 26-29, 2019, in Rennes, France. NIMBioS Working Group: Multiscale Vectored Plant Viruses From 2015 to 2019, I participated in the NIMBioS Working Group: Multiscale Vectored Plant Viruses .

docs.text: Modelling the COVID-19 epidemic in France Since 2020, I propose introductory mathematical epidemiology practicals based on the COVID-19 epidemic in France. They are gathered on this website (under construction, in French). Master MODE Since 2012, I co-head the Master's program in Ecological Modelling ( MODE ). MODE is a two-year research-oriented master course for students who are interested in mathematical, statistical and computational ecology and evolution. Classes are in English and French. I am in charge of the following courses: Models in Ecology and Evolution Models in Epidemiology among others. Modelling Plant Disease Epidemics At L'institut Agro , I teach Plant Disease Epidemiology with a focus on mathematical models.
